textBeforeTable: Casual Gaming The RealArcade Q&A on Gamezebo.com talks with Michael Schutzler of RealNetworks about their game distribution channel: "So we've been doing some digging into this. What we've discovered is that everyone plays casual games. Grandma and Grandpa are playing games. The kids are playing. And mom and dad are playing. This is the case in Japan, Germany, and in the US. Essentially, there is no real demographic for game play. Game purchasing, on the other hand, skews heavily female and that's true globally. In the US, game purchases are skewing about 65% female. In Europe and Japan, its more like 70+% And everywhere, its purchase are by women over 30." Grid Wars Grid Wars author's reflections on Eurogamer is an article-format conversation with the author of the game that closed down due to similarities with Geometry Wars: "I don't know if legally they have the right to shut it down - but I took it down out of respect for their developers and the cool work they do. I don't really think it is affecting their sales on Xbox 360 - but if they do want to move into the PC market then it's better if the confusion is cleared up," he conceded."
